intro: Tacazzea floribunda, commonly known as the white-flowered tacazzea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in summer. Native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa, it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant has a taproot system and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance and fragrance.
